availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Mary McMullen Eblen in Henderson County, Kentucky, on November 18, 1841. Father of John Eblen and Paulina Eblen. Married to Elizabeth Denton Eblen in Henderson County, Kentucky, on February 8, 1849. Father of Joseph Eblen. Married to Lucy D. Moseley Eblen in Henderson County, Kentucky, on June 27, 1854. Father of William B. Eblen, Andrew B. Eblen, Susan A. Eblen, and James D. Eblen. Farmer in Henderson County in 1850. Farmer in Henderson County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Henderson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, District 2, p. 327B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 1, p. 57.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 1, p. 139B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Cairo Precinct, p. 14A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994038, Henderson County Births.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Henderson County Marriages, Film 001944390.
"Thomas Jefferson Eblen (1820-1879)," Find A Grave, Memorial 69619517, accessed October 25, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/69619517.
